accessConsts.help: access constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations on obtaining the resource

Address.help: location of the responsible individual or organization

appProfile.help: name of an application profile that can be used with the online resource

AppSchInfo.help: information about the application schema used to build the dataset

appSchInfo.help: provides information about the conceptual schema of a dataset

artPage.help: details on which pages of the publication the article was published

asAscii.help: full application schema given as an ASCII file

asCstLang.help: formal language used in Application Schema

asGraFile.help: full application schema given as a graphics file

asName.help: name of the application schema used

asSchLang.help: identification of the schema language used

asSwDevFiFt.help: software dependent format used for the application schema software dependent file

asSwDevFile.help: full application schema given as a software development file

attDesc.help: description of the attribute described by the measurement value

attribIntSet.consdesc: attributes, features, featureInstances, dataset and other not documented
attribIntSet.help: attribute instances to which the information applies

attribSet.consdesc: features, featureInstances, attributeInstances, dataset and other not documented
attribSet.help: attributes to which the information applies

aziAngle.help: angle measured clockwise from north, and expressed in degrees

aziPtLong.help: longitude of the map projection origin

Band.help: range of wavelengths in the electromagnetic spectrum

begin.help: beginning date of the validity period

bgFileName.help: name of the file that contains a graphic that provides an illustration of the dataset

bgFileType.help: format in which the illustration is encoded

bitsPerVal.help: maximum number of significant bits in the uncompressed representation for the value in each band of each pixel

BoundPoly.help: boundary enclosing the dataset, expressed as the closed set of (x,y) coordinates of the polygon (last point replicates first point)

BrowGraph.help: graphic that provides an illustration of the dataset (should include a legend for the graphic)

camCalInAv.help: indication of whether or not constants are available which allow for camera calibration corrections

catCitation.help: complete bibliographic reference to one or more external feature catalogues

cellGeo.help: identification of grid data as point or cell

centerPt.help: earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cell halfway between opposite ends of the grid in the spatial dimensions

chkPtAv.help: indication of whether or not geographic position points are available to test the accuracy of the georeferenced grid data

chkPtDesc.help: description of geographic position points used to test the accuracy of the georeferenced grid data

citId.help: unique identifier for the resource. EXAMPLE: Universal Product Code (UPC), National Stock Number (NSN)

citIdType.help: reference form of the unique identifier (ID). Example: Universal Product Code (UPC), National Stock Number (NSN)

citRespParty.help: name and position information for an individual or organization that is responsible for the resource

class.help: name of the handling restrictions on the resource

cloudCovPer.help: area of the dataset obscured by clouds, expressed as a percentage of the spatial extent

cmpGenQuan.help: count of the number the number of lossy compression cycles performed on the image

cntAddress.help: physical and email address at which the organization or individual may be contacted

cntHours.help: time period (including time zone) when individuals can contact the organization or individual

cntInstr.help: supplemental instructions on how or when to contact the individual or organization

cntPhone.help: telephone numbers at which the organization or individual may be contacted

collTitle.help: common title with holdings note. NOTE title identifies elements of a series collectively, combined with information about what volumes are available at the source cited

compCode.help: indication of whether or not the cited feature catalogue complies with ISO 19110

conExpl.help: explanation of the meaning of conformance for this result

conPass.help: indication of the conformance result where 0 = fail and 1 = pass

ConResult.help: Information about the outcome of evaluating the obtained value (or set of values) against a specified acceptable conformance quality level

conSpec.help: citation of product specification or user requirement against which data is being evaluated

Consts.help: restrictions on the access and use of a resource or metadata

contentTyp.help: type of information represented by the cell value

ContInfo.help: description of the content of a dataset

contInfo.help: provides information about the feature catalogue and describes the coverage and image data characteristics

cornerPts.help: earth location in the coordinate system defined by the Spatial Reference System and the grid coordinate of the cells at opposite ends of grid coverage along two diagonals in the grid spatial dimensions. There are four corner points in a georectified grid; at least two corner points along one diagonal are required

CovDesc.help: information about the content of a grid data cell

covDim.help: information on the dimensions of the cell measurement value

ctrlPtAv.help: indication of whether or not control point(s) exists

dataChar.help: full name of the character coding standard used for the dataset

dataExt.consdesc: if hierarchyLevel equals “dataset” either extent.geographicElemen t.EX_GeographicBoundin gBox or extent.geographicElemen t.EX_GeographicDescript ion is required
dataExt.help: additional extent information including the bounding polygon, vertical, and temporal extent of the dataset

DataIdent.help: information required to identify a dataset

dataIdInfo.help: basic information about the resource(s) to which the metadata applies

dataLineage.help: non-quantitative quality information about the lineage of the data specified by the scope

DataQual.help: quality information for the data specified by a data quality scope

dataScale.help: factor which provides a general understanding of the density of spatial data in the dataset

datasetSeries.help: information about the series, or aggregate dataset, of which the dataset is a part

DatasetSeries.help: information about the series, or aggregate dataset, to which a dataset belongs

datasetSet.consdesc: attributes, features, featureInstances, attributeInstances, and other not documented
datasetSet.help: dataset to which the information applies

dataSource.consdesc: mandatory if statement and processStep not provided
dataSource.help: information about the source data used in creating the data specified by the scope

DateRef.help: reference date and event used to describe it (YYYY-MM-DD)

delPoint.help: address line for the location (as described in ISO 11180, annex A)

denFlatRat.help: ratio of the difference between the equatorial and polar radii of the ellipsoid to the equatorial radius when the numerator is set to 1

descKeys.help: provides category keywords, their type, and reference source

DigTranOps.help: technical means and media by which a resource is obtained from the distributor

dimDescrp.help: description of the range of a cell measurement value

dimResol.help: degree of detail in the grid dataset

dimSize.help: number of elements along the axis

distInfo.help: provides information about the distributor of and options for obtaining the resource(s)

distorCont.help: party from whom the resource may be obtained. This list need not be exhaustive

distorFormat.help: provides information about the format used by the distributor

distorOrdPrc.help: provides information about how the resource may be obtained, and related instructions and fee information

Distrib.help: information about the distributor of and options for obtaining the resource

distTranOps.help: provides information about technical means and media by which a resource is obtained from the distributor

DQAbsExtPosAcc.help: closeness of reported coordinate values to values accepted as or being true

DQAccTimeMeas.help: correctness of the temporal references of an item (reporting of error in time measurement)

DQCompComm.help: excess data present in the dataset, as described by the scope

DQCompOm.help: data absent from the dataset, as described by the scope

DQConcConsis.help: adherence to rules of the conceptual schema

DQDomConsis.help: adherence of values to the value domains

DQFormConsis.help: degree to which data is stored in accordance with the physical structure of the dataset, as described by the scope

DQGridDataPosAcc.help: closeness of gridded data position values to values accepted as or being true

dqInfo.help: provides overall assessment of quality of a resource(s)

DQRelIntPosAcc.help: closeness of the relative positions of features in the scope to their respective relative positions accepted as or being true

dqReport.help: quantitative quality information for the data specified by the scope

DQScope.help: description of the data specified by the scope

dqScope.help: the specific data to which the data quality information applies

DQTempConsis.help: correctness of ordered events or sequences, if reported

DQTempValid.help: validity of data specified by the scope with respect to time

DQThemClassCor.help: comparison of the classes assigned to features or their attributes to a universe of discourse

DQTopConsis.help: correctness of the explicitly encoded topological characteristics of the dataset as described by the scope

dsFormat.help: provides a description of the format of the resource(s)

eastBL.help: eastern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent, expressed in longitude in decimal degrees (positive east)

ellParas.help: set of parameters that describe the ellipsoid

EllParas.help: set of parameters that describe the ellipsoid

eMailAdd.help: address of the electronic mailbox of the responsible organization or individual

end.help: ending date of the validity period

envirDesc.help: description of the dataset in the producer_s processing environment, including items such as the software, the computer operating system, file name, and the dataset size

equScale.help: level of detail expressed as the scale of a comparable hardcopy map or chart

errStat.help: statistical method used to determine the value

evalMethType.help: type of method used to evaluate quality of the dataset

exDesc.consdesc: geographicElement and temporalElement and verticalElement not documented
exDesc.help: spatial and temporal extent for the referring object

exSpat.help: spatial extent component of composite spatial and temporal extent

extEleCond.help: condition under which the extended element is mandatory

extEleDomVal.help: valid values that can be assigned to the extended element

ExtEleInfo.help: new metadata element, not found in ISO 19115, which is required to describe geographic data

extEleInfo.help: provides information about a new metadata element, not found in ISO 19115, which is required to describe geographic data

extEleMxOc.help: maximum occurrence of the extended element

extEleName.help: name of the extended metadata element.

extEleParEnt.help: name of the metadata entity(s) under which this extended metadata element may appear. The name(s) may be standard metadata element(s) or other extended metadata element(s).

extEleRat.help: reason for creating the extended element

extEleRule.help: specifies how the extended element relates to other existing elements and entities

extEleSrc.help: name of the person or organization creating the extended element

exTemp.help: date and time for the content of the dataset

Extent.help: information about spatial, vertical, and temporal extent

extOnRes.help: information about on-line sources containing the community profile name and the extended metadata elements. Information for all new metadata elements

extShortName.help: short form suitable for use in an implementation method such as XML or SGML. NOTE other methods may be used

exTypeCode.help: indication of whether the bounding polygon encompasses an area covered by the data or an area where data is not present

falEastng.help: value added to all _x_ values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units

falENUnits.help: units of false northing and false easting

falNorthng.help: value added to all _y_ values in the rectangular coordinates for a map projection. This value frequently is assigned to eliminate negative numbers. Expressed in the unit of measure identified in Planar Coordinate Units

faxNum.help: telephone number of a facsimile machine for the responsible organization or individual

featIntSet.consdesc: attributes, features, attributeInstances, dataset and other not documented
featIntSet.help: feature instances to which the information applies

featSet.consdesc: attributes, featureInstances, attributeInstances, dataset and other not documented
featSet.help: features to which the information applies

featTypeList.help: provides information about the list of feature types with the same spatial representation

FeatTypList.help: list of names of feature types with the same spatial representation (same as spatial attributes)

fileDecmTech.help: recommendations of algorithms or processes that can be applied to read or expand resources to which compression techniques have been applied

filmDistInAv.help: indication of whether or not Calibration Reseau information is available

Format.help: description of the computer language construct that specifies the representation of data objects in a record, file, message, storage device or transmission channel

formatAmdNum.help: amendment number of the format version

formatName.help: name of the data transfer format(s)

formatSpec.help: name of a subset, profile, or product specification of the format

formatVer.help: version of the format (date, number, etc.)

geoBox.consdesc: if hierarchy level equals 'dataset' and geoDesc is not documented
geoBox.help: minimum bounding rectangle within which data is available

geoDesc.consdesc: if hierarchy level equals 'dataset' and geoBox is not documented
geoDesc.help: description of the geographic area within which data is available

GeoDesc.help: Description of the geographic area using identifiers

geoEle.consdesc: description and temporalElement and verticalElement not documented
geoEle.help: provides geographic component of the extent of the referring object

geoId.help: identifier used to represent a geographic area

geometObjs.help: information about the geometric objects used in the dataset

GeometObjs.help: number of objects, listed by geometric object type, used in the dataset

geoObjCnt.help: total number of the point or vector object type occurring in the dataset

geoObjTyp.help: name of point and vector spatial objects used to locate zero-, one-, and two-dimensional spatial locations in the dataset

Georect.help: grid whose cells are regularly spaced in a geographic (i.e., lat / long) or map coordinate system defined in the Spatial Referencing System (SRS) so that any cell in the grid can be geolocated given its grid coordinate and the grid origin, cell spacing, and orientation

Georef.help: grid with cells irregularly spaced in any given geographic/map projection coordinate system, whose individual cells can be geolocated using geolocation information supplied with the data but cannot be geolocated from the grid properties alone

georefPars.help: terms which support grid data georeferencing

graphOver.help: provides a graphic that illustrates the resource(s) (should include a legend for the graphic)

GridSpatRep.help: information about grid spatial objects in the dataset

handDesc.help: additional information about the restrictions on handling the resource

hgtProsPt.help: height of viewpoint above the Earth, expressed in metres

root.hgtProsPt: Height of prospective point above surface

idAbs.help: brief narrative summary of the content of the resource(s)

idCredit.help: recognition of those who contributed to the resource(s)

identAuth.help: person or party responsible for maintenance of the namespace

identCode.help: alphanumeric value identifying an instance in the namespace

idPoC.help: identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organizations(s) associated with the resource(s)

idPurp.help: summary of the intentions with which the resource(s) was developed

idSpecUse.help: provides basic information about specific application(s) for which the resource(s) has/have been or is being used by different users

illAziAng.help: illumination azimuth measured in degrees clockwise from true north at the time the image is taken. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image

illElevAng.help: illumination elevation measured in degrees clockwise from the target plane at intersection of the optical line of sight with the Earth_s surface. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image

ImgDesc.help: information about an image_s suitability for use

incWithDS.help: indication of whether or not the feature catalogue is included with the dataset

issId.help: information identifying the issue of the series

keyTyp.help: subject matter used to group similar keywords

keyword.help: commonly used word(s) or formalised word(s) or phrase(s) used to describe the subject

Keywords.help: keywords, their type and reference source

latProjCnt.help: latitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections

latProjOri.help: latitude chosen as the origin of rectangular coordinates for a map projection

LegConsts.help: restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource

lensDistInAv.help: indication of whether or not lens aberration correction information is available

Lineage.help: information about the events or source data used in constructing the data specified by the scope or lack of knowledge about lineage

linkage.help: location (address) for on-line access using a Uniform Resource Locator address or similar addressing scheme such as http://www.statkart.no/isotc211

longCntMer.help: line of longitude at the centre of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection

longProjCnt.help: longitude of the point of projection for azimuthal projections

maintFreq.help: frequency with which changes and additions are made to the resource after the initial resource is completed

MaintInfo.help: information about the scope and frequency of updating

maintNote.help: information regarding specific requirements for maintaining the resource

maintScp.help: scope of data to which maintenance is applied

maxVal.help: longest wavelength that the sensor is capable of collecting within a designated band

mdChar.consdesc: ISO/IEC 10646-1 not used and not defined by encoding
mdChar.help: full name of the character coding standard used for the metadata set

mdConst.help: provides restrictions on the access and use of data

mdContact.help: party responsible for the metadata information

MdCoRefSys.help: metadata about a coordinate system in which attributes have been derived from SC_CRS as defined in ISO 19111 _ Spatial referencing by coordinates

mdDateSt.help: date that the metadata was created (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss)

mdFileID.help: unique identifier for this metadata file

mdHrLv.help: scope to which the metadata applies (see annex H for more information about metadata hierarchy levels)

mdHrLvName.help: name of the hierarchy levels for which the metadata is provided

MdIdent.help: value uniquely identifying an object within a namespace

mdMaint.help: provides information about the frequency of metadata updates, and the scope of those updates

mdParentID.help: file identifier of the metadata to which this metadata is a subset (child)

mdStanName.help: name of the metadata standard (including profile name) used

mdStanVer.help: version (profile) of the metadata standard used

measDateTm.help: date or range of dates on which a data quality measure was applied (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss)

measId.help: code identifying a registered standard procedure

measName.help: name of the test applied to the data

measResult.help: value (or set of values) obtained from applying a data quality measure or the out come of evaluating the obtained value (or set of values) against a specified acceptable conformance quality level

medDensity.help: density at which the data is recorded

medDenUnits.help: units of measure for the recording density

medFormat.help: method used to write to the medium

Medium.help: information about the media on which the resource can be distributed

medName.help: name of the medium on which the resource can be received

medNote.help: description of other limitations or requirements for using the medium

medVol.help: number of items in the media identified

Metadata.help: root entity which defines metadata about a resource or resources

minVal.help: shortest wavelength that the sensor is capable of collecting within a designated band

northBL.help: northern-most, coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent expressed in latitude in decimal degrees (positive north)

ObLineAzi.help: method used to describe the line along which an oblique mercator map projection is centred using the map projection origin and an azimuth

obLineLat.help: latitude of a point defining the oblique line

obLineLong.help: longitude of a point defining the oblique line

ObLinePt.help: method used to describe the line along which an oblique mercator map projection is centred using two points near the limits of the mapped region that define the centre line

obLnAziPars.help: parameters describing the oblique line azimuth

obLnPtPars.help: parameters describing the oblique line point

offset.help: the physical value corresponding to a cell value of zero

OnlineRes.help: information about on-line sources from which the dataset, specification, or community profile name and extended metadata elements can be obtained

onLineSrc.help: information about online sources from which the resource can be obtained

orDesc.help: detailed text description of what the online resource is/does

ordInstr.help: general instructions, terms and services provided by the distributor

ordTurn.help: typical turnaround time for the filling of an order

orFunct.help: code for function performed by the online resource

orieParaAv.help: indication of whether or not orientation parameters are available

othConsts.help: other restrictions and legal prerequisites for accessing and using the resource

other.consdesc: attributes, features, featureInstances, attributeInstances, and dataset not documented
other.help: class of information that does not fall into the other categories to which the information applies

otherCitDet.help: other information required to complete the citation that is not recorded elsewhere

paraCit.help: reference providing description of the parameters

pkResp.help: wavelength at which the response is the highest

planAvDtTm.help: date and time when the dataset will be available (CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss)

polygon.help: sets of points defining the bounding polygon

porCatInfo.help: provides information about the catalogue of rules defined for the portrayal of a resource(s)

portCatCit.help: bibliographic reference to the portrayal catalogue cited

PortCatRef.help: information identifying the portrayal catalogue used

PrcessStep.help: information about an event in the creation process for the data specified by the scope

prcStep.consdesc: mandatory if statement and source not provided
prcStep.help: information about an event in the creation process for the data specified by the scope

prcTypCde.help: image distributor_s code that identifies the level of radiometric and geometric processing that has been applied

presForm.help: mode in which the resource is represented

projParas.help: set of parameters that describe the projection

ProjParas.help: set of parameters that describe the projection

ptInPixel.help: point in a pixel corresponding to the Earth location of the pixel

QuanResult.help: Information about the value (or set of values) obtained from applying a data quality measure

quanValType.help: value type for reporting a data quality result

quanValUnit.help: value unit for reporting a data quality result

radCalDatAv.help: indication of whether or not the radiometric calibration information for generating the radiometrically calibrated standard data product is available

RangeDim.help: information on the range of each dimension of a cell measurement value

refDate.help: reference date for the cited resource (YYYY-MM-DD)

refSysID.consdesc: MD_CRS.projection, MD_CRS.ellipsoid, and MD_CRS.datum not documented

refSysInfo.help: description of the spatial and temporal reference systems used in the dataset

RepFract.help: derived from Scale where MD_RepresentativeFraction.denominator = 1 / Scale.measure And Scale.targetUnits = Scale.sourceUnits

resAltTitle.help: short name or other language name by which the cited information is known. Example: "DCW" as an alternative title for "Digital Chart of the World

resConst.help: provides information about constraints which apply to the resource(s)

resFees.help: fees and terms for retrieving the resource. Include monetary units (as specified in ISO 4217)

resMaint.help: provides information about the frequency of resource updates, and the scope of those updates

Resol.help: level of detail expressed as a scale factor or a ground distance

RespParty.help: identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organizations associated with the dataset

resRefDate.help: reference date for the cited resource (YYYY-MM-DD)

resTitle.help: name by which the cited resource is known

Result.help: generalization of more specific result classes

rfDenom.help: the number below the line in a vulgar fraction

role.help: function performed by the responsible party

rpIndName.help: name of the responsible person- surname, given name, title separated by a delimiter

rpPosName.help: role or position of the responsible person

sclFac.help: scale factor which has been applied to the cell value

sclFacCnt.help: ratio between physical distance and corresponding map distance, along the centre line

sclFacEqu.help: ratio between physical distance and corresponding map distance, along the equator

sclFacPrOr.help: multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling tot he actual distance at the projection origin

ScpDesc.help: description of the class of information covered by the information

scpExt.help: information about the spatial, vertical and temporal extent of the data specified by the scope

scpLvl.help: hierarchical level of the data specified by the scope

scpLvlDesc.help: detailed description about the level of the data specified by the scope

SecConsts.help: handling restrictions imposed on the resource for national security or similar security concerns

semiMajAx.help: radius of the equatorial axis of the ellipsoid

seqID.help: number that uniquely identifies instances of bands of wavelengths on which a sensor operates

seriesName.help: name of the series, or aggregate dataset, of which the dataset is a part

Source.help: information about the source data used in creating the data specified by the scope

southBL.help: southern-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent, expressed in latitude in decimal degrees (positive north)

SpatAttSup.help: spatial attributes in the application schema for the feature types

spatObj.help: instance of a type defined in the spatial schema

spatRepInfo.help: digital representation of spatial information in the dataset

spatRpType.help: method used to spatially represent geographic information

spatSchName.help: name of the spatial schema used

SpatTempEx.help: extent with respect to date/time and spatial boundaries

specUsage.help: brief description of the resource and/or resource series usage

srcCitatn.help: recommended reference to be used for the source data

srcDesc.help: detailed description of the level of the source data

srcExt.help: information about the spatial, vertical and temporal extent of the source data

srcRefSys.help: spatial reference system used by the source data

srcScale.help: denominator of the representative fraction on a source map

srcStep.help: information about an event in the creation process for the source data

StanOrdProc.help: common ways in which the resource may be obtained or received, and related instructions and fee information

statement.help: general explanation of the data producer_s knowledge about the lineage of a dataset

stepDateTm.help: date and time or range of date and time on or over which the process step occurred (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss)

stepDesc.help: description of the event, including related parameters or tolerances

stepProc.help: identification of, and means of communication with, person(s) and organization(s) associated with the process step

stepRat.help: requirement or purpose for the process step

stepSrc.help: information about the source data used in creating the data specified by the scope

stVrLongPl.help: longitude to be oriented straight up from the North or South Pole

suppInfo.help: any other descriptive information about the dataset

Telephone.help: telephone numbers for contacting the responsible individual or organization

tempEle.consdesc: description and geographicElement and verticalElement not documented
tempEle.help: provides temporal component of the extent of the referring object

TempExtent.help: time period covered by the content of the dataset

thesaName.help: name of the formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of keywords

toneGrad.help: number of discrete numerical values in the grid data

topLvl.help: code which identifies the degree of complexity of the spatial relationships

tranParaAv.help: indication of whether or not parameters for transformation exists

transDimDesc.help: description of the information about which grid dimensions are the spatial dimensions

transDimMap.help: information about which grid dimensions are the spatial dimensions

transSize.help: estimated size of a unit in the specified transfer format, expressed in megabytes. The transfer size is > 0.0

trianInd.help: indication of whether or not triangulation has been performed upon the image

unitsODist.help: tiles, layers, geographic areas, etc., in which data is available

upScpDesc.help: additional information about the range or extent of the resource

Usage.help: brief description of ways in which the resource(s) is/are currently used

usageDate.help: date and time of the first use or range of uses of the resource and/or resource series (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss)

useConsts.help: constraints applied to assure the protection of privacy or intellectual property, and any special restrictions or limitations or warnings on using the resource

useLimit.help: limitation affecting the fitness for use of the resource. Example, _not to be used for navigation_

userNote.help: explanation of the application of the legal constraints or other restrictions and legal prerequisites for obtaining and using the resource

usrCntInfo.help: identification of and means of communicating with person(s) and organization(s) using the resource(s)

usrDefFreq.help: maintenance period other than those defined

usrDetLim.help: applications, determined by the user for which the resource and/or resource series is not suitable

valUnit.help: units in which sensor wavelengths are expressed

VectSpatRep.help: information about the vector spatial objects in the dataset

vertDatum.help: provides information about the origin from which the maximum and minimum elevation values are measured

vertEle.consdesc: description and geographicElement and temporalElement not documented
vertEle.help: provides vertical component of the extent of the referring object

vertMaxVal.help: highest vertical extent contained in the dataset

vertMinVal.help: lowest vertical extent contained in the dataset

vertUoM.help: vertical units used for vertical extent information. Examples: metres, feet, millimetres, hectopascals

voiceNum.help: telephone number by which individuals can speak to the responsible organization or individual

westBL.help: western-most coordinate of the limit of the dataset extent, expressed in longitude in decimal degrees (positive east)

zone.help: unique identifier for 100,000 metre grid zone

value.help: date identifies when the resource was brought into existence
date identifies when the resource was issued
date identifies when the resource was examined or re-examined and improved or amended
online instructions for transferring data from one storage device or system to another
online information about the resource
online instructions for requesting the resource from the provider
online order process for obtaining the resource
online search interface for seeking out information about the resource
digital representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also)
representation of a primarily textual item (can contain illustrations also) on paper, photographic material, or other media

likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and stored in digital format

likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and reproduced on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user
map represented in raster or vector form
map printed on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user
multi-dimensional digital representation of a feature, process, etc.
3-dimensional, physical model
vertical cross-section in digital form
vertical cross-section printed on paper, etc.
digital representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns
representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns, printed on paper, photographic material, or other media
digital video recording
video recording on film
party that supplies the resource
party that accepts accountability and responsibility for the data and ensures appropriate care and maintenance of the resource
party that owns the resource
party who uses the resource
party who distributes the resource
party who created the resource
party who can be contacted for acquiring knowledge about or acquisition of the resource
key party responsible for gathering information and conducting research.
party who has processed the data in a manner such that the resource has been modified
party who published the resource
method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where all data required is internal to the dataset being evaluated
method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on inspection of items within the dataset, where reference data external to the dataset being evaluated is required
method of evaluating the quality of a dataset based on external knowledge
reference from one dataset to another
reference to a master dataset of which this one is a part
part of same structured set of data held in a computer
mapping and charting information from which the dataset content originates
part of a set of imagery that when used together, provides three-dimensional images
series of organized planned actions
accumulation of datasets assembled for a specific purpose
specific performance of a function or group of functions
process designed to find if something is effective or valid
